\ Steo's blog :: Moving to Gitlab pages

Free thoughts on a leash

Home Blog Resources Code About

Last day I've discovered, by chance, a "new" feature from Gitlab: Gitlab pages.

Gitlab pages is exactly what you could expect from the name: the Giltab's version of the quite famous Github pages.

So, why bother the change?

First, it could be nice to try something new, but mainly cause Gitlab pages comes with maybe less fancy presentations but more templates and a wider support of different generators, while Github pages focus only on Jekyll.

And since I'm using Hakyll, it looked like a natural choice (other than I'm already using Gitlab for som eof my projects...). So, let's move on...

Keeping GIT...

Free thoughts on a leash
